1:
God, why have you rejected us forever?\q Why does your anger burn against the sheep of your pasture?
\q
2:
Call to mind your people, whom you purchased in ancient times,\q the tribe whom you have redeemed to be your own heritage,
\q and Mount Zion, where you live.


\q
3:
Come look at the complete ruins,\q all the damage that the enemy has done in the holy place.
\q
4:
Your adversaries roared in the middle of your appointed place;\q they set up their battle flags.
\q
5:
They hacked away with axes\q as in a thick forest.
\q
6:
They smashed and broke down all the engravings;\q they broke them with axes and hammers.


\q
7:
They set your sanctuary on fire;\q they desecrated where you live, knocking it to the ground.
\q
8:
They said in their hearts, "We will destroy them all."\q They burned up all of your meeting places in the land.


\q
9:
We do not see any more signs;\q there is no prophet any more,
\q and no one among us knows how long this will last.
\q
10:
How long, God, will the enemy throw insults at you?\q Will the enemy blaspheme your name forever?
\q
11:
Why do you hold back your hand, your right hand?\q Take your right hand from your garment and destroy them.


\q
12:
Yet God has been my king from ancient times,\q bringing salvation on the earth.
\q
13:
You divided the sea by your strength;\q you smashed the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.


\q
14:
You crushed the heads of leviathan;\q you fed him to those living in the wilderness.
\q
15:
You broke open springs and streams;\q you dried up flowing rivers.


\q
16:
The day is yours, and the night is yours also;\q you set the sun and moon in place.
\q
17:
You have set all the borders of the earth;\q you have made summer and winter.


\q
18:
Call to mind how the enemy hurled insults at you, Yahweh,\q and that a foolish people has blasphemed your name.
\q
19:
Do not give the life of your dove to a wild animal.\q Do not forget forever the life of your oppressed people.


\q
20:
Remember your covenant,\q for the dark regions of the land are full of places of violence.
\q
21:
Do not let the oppressed be turned back in shame;\q let the poor and oppressed praise your name.


\q
22:
Arise, God; defend your own honor;\q call to mind how fools insult you all day long.
\q
23: Do not forget the voice of your adversaries\q or the uproar of those who continually defy you.
